section.title: Namespaces
section.para:
Majisti is entirely written with PHP5.3. Meaning that it makes use of the new features such as lamba functions, late static binding and namespaces. Those new features provide maximum flexibility and Majisti strives to make the best use of them. However, since Majisti uses Zend as its backbone framework, which is using a namespacing mechanism of its own, it cannot use PHP5.3 namespace everywhere. Trying to extend all the components to assure that every single one is PHP5.3 namespace compatible is not within Majisti's scope. Therefore, Majisti will rely and wait on Zend 2.0 to consider whether full PHP5.3 namespace would be needed. Currently, Majisti support PHP namespaces for those components:
All core classes (e.g \Majisti\Config\Handler)
Application Resources, provided you add the "pluginsPath" in the configuration. See Majisti Application Resources for more information.

And the ones not supported by Majisti:
View helpers, controller plugins and autoloaded resources using the Module autoloader. They must use the Zend Standard. (e.g. To instanciate a model you would do the ApplicationName_Model_AModel convention to access it).
